prompt: <description>Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Flat Top and Bottom Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side featuring a rectangular hole in the center. 2D Sketch Begin by creating a new coordinate system at (0.1711, 0.0145, 0) with euler angles (0, 0, 0). Create a new sketch on the XY plane. 1. Draw the bottom arc (arc\\_1) centered at the origin, with a radius of 0.2018 and an angle of 180 degrees, clockwise from the positive X direction. 2. Draw a line (line\\_1) from the endpoint of arc\\_1 to the origin. 3. Draw the top arc (arc\\_2) centered at the origin, with a radius of 0.2018 and an angle of 180 degrees, counterclockwise from the positive X direction. 4. Draw a line (line\\_2) from the endpoint of arc\\_2 to the origin. Scaling Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.6631 (sketch\\_scale). 3D Transformation Transform the scaled sketch using the following euler angles: (0, 0, 0) and translation vector: (0.1711, 0, 0). Extrusion Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.4839 units towards the normal, forming the 3D model. The height of part\\_1 is 0.4839, which is measured along the Z-axis. The width and length of this part are both 0.6631, and are measured along the X and Y axes respectively. Part 2: Tapered Cylinder Construct a tapered cylinder with a flat top and bottom that narrows slightly towards the bottom. 2D Sketch Create a new coordinate system at (0.1711, 0, 0) with euler angles (0, 0, 0). Create a new sketch on the XY plane. 1. Draw the bottom arc (arc\\_1) centered at the origin, with a radius of 0.2018 and an angle of 180 degrees, clockwise from the positive X direction. 2. Draw a line (line\\_1) from the endpoint of arc\\_1 to the origin. 3. Draw the top arc (arc\\_2) centered at the origin, with a radius of 0.2018 and an angle of 180 degrees, counterclockwise from the positive X direction. 4. Draw a line (line\\_2) from the endpoint of arc\\_2 to the origin. Scaling Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.6897 (sketch\\_scale). 3D Transformation Transform the scaled sketch using the following euler angles: (0, 0, 0) and translation vector: (0.1711, 0, 0). Extrusion Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.0242 units towards the normal, forming the 3D model. The height of part\\_2 is 0.0242, which is measured along the Z-axis. The width and length of this part are both 0.6897, and are measured along the X and Y axes respectively. Merge part\\_1 and part\\_2, ensuring that the top face of part\\_1 aligns with the bottom face of part\\_2 to form a tapered cylinder. The final shape is a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered shape, narrowing slightly towards the bottom, and a flat top and bottom. The top and bottom edges are sharp and straight. The object is symmetrical along its central axis. The height is approximately three times the diameter.</description>
